history.content:
For context I took Prob 140 last semester, and am taking EECS 127 this semester

The workload is comparable in the sense that they're both HW heavy classes. For me, the 127 HWs consistently take 8-9 hours. In the case of 140, the actual HWs would probably take ~8 hours, but that's after I'd spend at least 3-4 hours reading the relevant textbook chapters and doing the recommended practice problems. 127 has a project this semester but the grading scheme basically means it's optional (if you don't do the project your midterm and final are weighted more). 140 doesn't have a project, but it does have weekly labs that take 3-4 hours each. 140 also has 2 hrs discussion/week to 127's 1 hr discussion/week

In conclusion 140 consistently had a heavier workload imo, but if you're not fluent with linear algebra then 127 can also be very heavy workload. IF you have any other questions let me know, but I'm not sure I'd advise either class in addition to CS70 and CS 61C unless you're used to a heavy tech workload

How do the difficulty and workload compare against these two classes? I'm looking to add a technical along to CS 70 and 61C.
history.subject: EECS 127 vs Stat 140
